channel.title: 经济学人

item.title: 如果壳牌的撤资最终完成，国内公司将在尼日利亚历史上首次拥有比外国集团更多的石油许可证👇。
item.description:
If Shell’s divestment is finalised, domestic companies will own more oil licences than foreign groups for the first time in Nigeria’s history https://t.co/29A9yErHY7 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 日本的典型性别角色--工薪族丈夫和家庭主妇--是在战后长期繁荣时期形成的。现在，日本男性正面临身份危机。
item.description:
Japan’s archetypal gender roles—the salaryman husband and stay-at-home mum—were cemented during the country’s long post-war boom. Now Japanese men are facing an identity crisis https://t.co/FkYNUxSORP 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 在过去的四年里，波音公司一直在努力纠正错误，但都以失败告终，公司首席执行官宣布他将于 2024 年底卸任。这张图表显示了一连串让这个曾经高高在上的航空业巨头跌入低谷的事件： ↪👇
item.description:
After trying—and failing—to right Boeing over the past four years, the company’s chief executive has announced he will step down at the end of 2024. This chart shows the string of incidents that have brought the once high-flying aerospace giant low: https://t.co/vqRrVb6H1R 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 巴基斯坦军队可能已经逃脱了最近一次选举抢劫。但它能继续控制局面吗？有两个理由让人认为该国的将军们可能会陷入困境👇。
item.description:
Pakistan’s army may have gotten away with its latest election heist. But can it maintain control? There are two reasons to think the country’s generals could struggle https://t.co/ZaVLZYIDMO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 试管婴儿让大多数妇女失望了。根本问题在于，人们对生育能力的了解仍然少得令人震惊。但新的研究为革命带来了希望 👇。
item.description:
IVF is failing most women. The fundamental problem is that fertility is still shockingly poorly understood. But new research holds out hope of a revolution https://t.co/cpJd1aEgpe 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 市场给了年轻人一手烂牌。他们可以打得更好。他们应该这样投资 👇
item.description:
Markets have dealt young people a bad hand. They could be playing it better. This is how they should invest https://t.co/8vBJ79D95f 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 它们本来是用来治疗糖尿病的。新一代减肥药的其他益处是意外发现的 👇
item.description:
They were intended to treat diabetes. The other benefits of a new generation of weight-loss drugs were discovered by accident https://t.co/vjRcIsFlqN 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 新药可能会终结世界肥胖症的流行。必须仔细研究其长期影响--但兴奋是有道理的 👇
item.description:
New drugs could spell an end to the world’s obesity epidemic. The long-term effects must be carefully studied—but the excitement is justified https://t.co/IrSQdLFbQw👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 一部 19 世纪的法律会如何颠覆美国的堕胎机会？在最高法院审议米非司酮--两种用于人工流产的药物之一--的规则时，我们解释了一项有 150 年历史的反黄片法可能发挥的作用。
item.description:
How could a 19th-century law upend abortion access in America? As the Supreme Court considers rules for mifepristone, one of the two drugs used to induce abortions, we explain what role a 150-year-old anti-vice law could play https://t.co/31wLoA2NLO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 长期以来，印度一直与饥饿为伴，如今却面临着肥胖和生活方式疾病流行的问题 👇
item.description:
Long associated with hunger, India is now confronting an epidemic of obesity and lifestyle diseases https://t.co/p5Xv01k0h7 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 活到 120 岁正成为一个可以想象的前景。令人兴奋的是，这些额外的岁月将是健康的，但会产生广泛的影响👇。
item.description:
Living to 120 is becoming an imaginable prospect. Excitingly, those extra years would be healthy—but there would be wide ramifications https://t.co/A75fQzFVug 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 2023 年，中国人口连续第二年下降。独生子女政策并不是造成这一危机的唯一原因，但其遗留问题将使中国难以摆脱人口厄运： 克洛伊-库什曼
item.description:
China’s population declined for the second year in a row in 2023. The one-child policy is not the sole reason for this crisis, but its legacy will make it exceptionally hard for the country to escape demographic doom: https://t.co/y2GEQP09yM

Illustration: Chloe Cushman pic.twitter.com/EQYposaNt8

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 在本周的 "Money Talks "播客中，@Alice_Ffulwood、@Birdyword 和 @TomLeeDevlin 将询问中国电子商务巨头特慕对亚马逊的威胁有多大 🎧 。
item.description:
On this week’s “Money Talks” podcast, @alice_fulwood, @Birdyword and @TomLeeDevlin ask how much of a threat Temu, the Chinese e-commerce giant, poses to Amazon https://t.co/PwZ4sU4YaC 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 芬太尼现在几乎可以肯定是 18 至 49 岁美国人的最大杀手。经济学家可能终于找到了危机的令人信服的解释👇。
item.description:
Fentanyl is now almost certainly the biggest killer of Americans between the ages of 18 and 49. Economists may have at last found a convincing explanation for the crisis https://t.co/qpIrqMLJKv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 西班牙裔选民能否决定美国大选？我们的 "制衡 "播客将对摇摆不定的选民进行调查，这是不定期系列报道的第一部分。敬请收听 @JohnPrideaux、@chowardchoward 和 @imkahloon 🎧 。
item.description:
Could Hispanic voters decide America’s election? In the first part of an occasional series checking in on swing voters, our “Checks and Balance” podcast investigates. With @JohnPrideaux, @chowardchoward and @imkahloon https://t.co/bttoVFX9JT 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: "没有人注定只投民主党或共和党的票"来自@NALEO的阿图罗-巴尔加斯（Arturo Vargas）在 "制衡 "节目中说，美国拉美裔的选票将在11月被争夺。
item.description:
“No one is predestined to vote only as a Democrat or only as a Republican.”

Arturo Vargas from @NALEO says America’s Latino vote is up for grabs in November, on “Checks and Balance” https://t.co/rXsh3IqCaV 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: Freakonomics》（《怪诞经济学》）是这一浪潮的顶点，它承诺对传统智慧所忽略的事物进行古怪但严谨的分析。这种方法很有趣，但已经失宠👇。
item.description:
Freakonomics” was at the apex of a wave of books that promised a quirky—yet rigorous—analysis of things that the conventional wisdom had missed. The approach was fun, but has fallen out favour https://t.co/4EtyegZh3N 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 美国 11 月的总统选举几乎肯定会是近 70 年来首次重选。通过我们的选举民调跟踪器，您可以找到最新的民调、两位主要候选人的简短介绍以及选举日程中的关键日期： 👇
item.description:
America’s presidential election in November will almost certainly be the first rematch in almost 70 years. Find the latest polls, short guides to the two main candidates and key dates in the electoral calendar with our election poll tracker: https://t.co/u49lMKFXZR 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 许多人在离开大学时都背负着沉重的债务，获得的学位也只是一个无关紧要的、教学质量很差的学位。他们被骗了，没有为更好的生活做好准备👇。
item.description:
Many leave university loaded with debt and equipped with a degree of peripheral relevance that has been taught badly. They are being ripped off, not prepared for a better life https://t.co/KxMtkklegd 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 27, 2024

item.title: 美国最高法院听取了质疑 FDA 有关米非司酮规定的辩论，米非司酮是用于堕胎的两种药物之一。我们将解释支持堕胎的运动者是如何利用 19 世纪的法律来支持他们的观点的。
item.description:
America’s Supreme Court heard arguments challenging the FDA’s rules on mifepristone, one of the two drugs used to induce abortions. We explain how pro-life campaigners are using a 19th-century law to bolster their case https://t.co/77dmTmtZVk 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥的垮塌将对巴尔的摩造成伤害。但它也将彰显这座城市的韧性👇。
item.description:
The collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge will hurt Baltimore. But it will highlight the city’s resilience, too https://t.co/8EwUerOwCD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 一个多月前，塞内加尔还处于宪政危机之中。但该国最近举行的大选证明，末日论者错了 👇。
item.description:
Senegal was in the midst of a constitutional crisis little more than a month ago. But the country’s recent election proved the doomsayers wrong https://t.co/Q107N8ktw4 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 约翰-博尔顿警告说，拜登和特朗普对美国在世界上应有地位的理解存在 "严重缺陷"。"这位前国家安全顾问认为："令美国的敌人高兴的是，无论他们中的哪一个获胜，未来四年都将是漫长而严峻的：
item.description:
Biden and Trump have a “badly flawed” understanding of America’s proper place in the world, warns John Bolton. “To the delight of America’s enemies, whichever of them wins, a long, grim four years lie ahead,” the former national security adviser argues: https://t.co/h6SskXaomn pic.twitter.com/RXKnmhQwSI

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥的垮塌将对巴尔的摩造成伤害。但它也将彰显这座美国城市的韧性： 盖蒂图片社
item.description:
The collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge will hurt Baltimore. But it will also highlight the American city’s resilience: https://t.co/VrE3QIVpHx

Photo: Getty Images pic.twitter.com/E5YDnNAFkd

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 美国、英国和新西兰提供了中国间谍活动的丰富细节。如何看待中国的大规模网络间谍活动？
item.description:
America, Britain and New Zealand are offering rich details of what Chinese spies are up to. Here’s what to make of China’s massive cyber-espionage campaign https://t.co/JdFk83lKDA 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 本周的 "鼓楼 "播客中，@aliceysu 和 @DSORennie 将探讨美国众议院批准的法案背后的真相，该法案可能会在全国范围内强制禁止 TikTok 🎧 。
item.description:
This week on our “Drum Tower” podcast, @aliceysu and @DSORennie look at what’s really behind the bill approved by America’s House of Representatives that could force a ban of TikTok nationwide https://t.co/h6rupeqHSW 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 最近的两项研究揭示了太平洋东北部深海虎鲸种群独特的狩猎文化 👇。
item.description:
The killer whale is a diverse species.Two recent studies have shed some light on the unique hunting cultures of the populations that stalk the deep waters off the north-east ­Pacific Ocean https://t.co/DzeLWZi8NQ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024
